subject: URGENT: Two Boston organizers cannot see events - likely frontend ROLE switch issue
body:
Sarah,

Two Boston organizers reported issues today. Backend data is verified intact.

## User 1: Elana (minuteman.tango.practica@gmail.com)
- Organizer: Tango Practica Corazon
- 13 future events exist in DB, all isActive:true
- Symptoms:
  1. When logged in: sees NO events (as visitor sees all)
  2. Cannot adjust map when logged in
  3. When switching to ORGANIZER ROLE: cannot see her events
  4. Cannot add or change anything in organizer mode
- Backend status: Account OK, roles OK (NamedUser + RegionalOrganizer)

## User 2: Simonida (tangoaffair@gmail.com)
- Organizer: TangoAffair / Vida Mia
- 8 future events exist in DB
- Symptoms:
  1. Cannot see any events in calendar
  2. Map center save not working (says she sets Boston, keeps resetting)
  3. Events she added YESTERDAY are GONE (not in DB - save failed?)
  4. Has classes starting in 2 weeks, cannot add them
- Backend status: Account OK, roles OK

## Common Pattern
Both users have issues when LOGGED IN and when switching to ORGANIZER role. This suggests:
1. User context/state not loading properly after login
2. Organizer role switch not querying events correctly
3. Map center save endpoint might be failing silently
4. Event creation might be failing silently (Simonida's missing events)

## Backend Verified
- Both accounts exist with correct permissions
- Events exist in MongoDB with isActive:true
- Login tracking shows they ARE logging in successfully
- API endpoints responding (I can query their data)

This appears to be a frontend state management or API call issue when user role changes.

-- Fulton (calendar-be-af)
